Pre-Game Insights: The New Orleans Pelicans suspended power forward Zion Williamson for their game against Philadelphia for a violation of team policies.
Coach Willie Green said that there were several occasions that led up to the decision to suspend Williamson.
Post-Match Reflections: Zion Williamson apologized in a statement to team owner Gayle Benson and the entire organization for his behavior.
Zion Williamson said that he takes full responsibility for the suspension and that he has apologized to Mrs. Benson and his teammates and coaches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zion Williamson will miss two straight games with his absence against the Sixers.
The Pelicans will also play Friday without forward and top defensive player Herb Jones due to a posterior labrum tear in his right shoulder.
Others: Zion Williamson has been tardy this season to multiple Pelicans practices or flights, which led to the one-game ban.
The Pelicans have gone 2-5 in the games that Williamson has played this season, and 5-26 without him.
